Sequence Information.Function: Possesses antifungal activity sensitive to inorganic cations. Induces potential changes in fungal membranes and increased K(+) efflux and Ca(2+) uptake.

Literature.Title: Small cysteine-rich antifungal proteins from radish: their role in host defense.
Literature.Author: Osborn R.W.,Raikhel N.V.,Kovaleva V.,Eggermont K.,Terras F.R.G.

Literature.Title: Analysis of two novel classes of plant antifungal proteins from radish (Raphanus sativus L.) seeds.
Literature.Author: Rees S.B.,van Leuven F.,de Bolle M.F.C.,Schoofs H.M.E.,Terras F.R.G.

Literature.Title: Fungal membrane responses induced by plant defensins and thionins.
Literature.Author: Osborn R.W.,Brownlee C.,De Samblanx G.W.,Ghazi A.,Thevissen K.

Literature.Title: Mutational analysis of a plant defensin from radish (Raphanus sativus L.) reveals two adjacent sites important for antifungal activity.
Literature.Author: Fant F.,Raemaekers R.,Thevissen K.,Goderis I.J.,De Samblanx G.W.
